class.name: MeshInstance3D
class.brief_description: Node that instances meshes into a scenario.
class.description: MeshInstance3D is a node that takes a [Mesh] resource and adds it to the current scenario by creating an instance of it. This is the class most often used render 3D geometry and can be used to instance a single [Mesh] in many places. This allows reuse of geometry which can save on resources. When a [Mesh] has to be instanced more than thousands of times at close proximity, consider using a [MultiMesh] in a [MultiMeshInstance3D] instead.

method.name: create_convex_collision
method.description: This helper creates a [StaticBody3D] child node with a [ConvexPolygonShape3D] collision shape calculated from the mesh geometry. It's mainly used for testing.

method.name: create_debug_tangents
method.description: This helper creates a [MeshInstance3D] child node with gizmos at every vertex calculated from the mesh geometry. It's mainly used for testing.

method.name: create_trimesh_collision
method.description: This helper creates a [StaticBody3D] child node with a [ConcavePolygonShape3D] collision shape calculated from the mesh geometry. It's mainly used for testing.

method.name: get_active_material
method.description: Returns the [Material] that will be used by the [Mesh] when drawing. This can return the [member GeometryInstance3D.material_override], the surface override [Material] defined in this [MeshInstance3D], or the surface [Material] defined in the [Mesh]. For example, if [member GeometryInstance3D.material_override] is used, all surfaces will return the override material.

method.name: get_surface_material
method.description: Returns the override [Material] for the specified surface of the [Mesh] resource.

method.name: get_surface_material_count
method.description: Returns the number of surface materials.

method.name: set_surface_material
method.description: Sets the override [Material] for the specified surface of the [Mesh] resource. This material is associated with this [MeshInstance3D] rather than with the [Mesh] resource.

members.member: [NodePath] to the [Skeleton3D] associated with the instance.
Sets the skin to be used by this instance.
